question:
Recently, IMF predicted that Guyana will be the fastest growing country in 2020. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. Guyana lies on the western coast of Africa.
  2. Oil deposits are present in Guyana.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Guyana lies on the northern coast of South America. It is one of the founding members of the CARICOM group. It has its northern coast along the Atlantic Ocean. Its neighbouring countries are Brazil, Venezuela and Suriname. It has some of the largest rainforests in the continent.Â  Statement 2 is correct: Recently, petroleum reserves were discovered in the country. It is expected to get a petroleum revenue of 300 million USD in 2020. In light of this, IMF predicted that Guyana will be the fastest growing country in 2020. Its GDP is expected to exceed 86% in 2020.
